alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 22 at 7:42PM MDT until April 22 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Los Alamos County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Northern Santa Fe County in north central New Mexico... * Until 845 PM MDT. * At 741 PM MDT, an area of dust was over the Santa Fe Metro Area northward toward Espanola. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery and surface observations. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 249 and 302. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 282 and 340. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 11 and 19. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, Los Alamos, Espanola, White Rock, Pojoaque, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Santo Domingo Pueblo, Chimayo, Santa Clara Pueblo and San Felipe Pueblo. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust creates reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Santa Fe
